title.narrative: Productive initiative for young afros descent

description.narrative: AFRODES (Colombian NGO created in 1999) is one of the most important organizations of displaced African descent in the country. In recent years it has consolidated its organizational structure in order to facilitate dialogue between State institutions and other authorities in charge of support displaced afro descendants.In the previous years, ICCO has been supporting the implementation of various activities of AFRODES, especially its mission to rescue children and young people from the risks of armed conflict, urban violence in South Bogota and other risks such as drug addiction and alcoholism by conducting sporting and cultural activities. It´s important to keep supporting this partner in the construction of reconciliation initiatives with a differential approach.

This project seeks to: Specific Objective 1. Continue rescuing children and teenagers from the risks mentioned above but also; Specific Objective 2. Increase political participation of young afro descendants through their impact at the municipal level in cultural and sport policies in Soacha, Cundinamarca in the south Bogotá.Furthermore, in order to consolidate those cultural and sports processes, the project will place them in an institutional economic enterprise plan that on one hand allows th

comment.narrative: Previous network developed influence in the peace negociations, by including a etnic chapter in the habana peace agreement
